website_summaries.verdict: An attractive but basic messenger bag that offers a lot of space for a low price point.
pros: Features rugged material and lots of space
Has side pockets and interior pouch for added carrying room
Metal accents on canvas create a vintage look on a bag suitable for modern needs
cons: Some of our testers noted that the Velcro closure isn't very secure
Lacks interior padding for laptop protection

customer_reviews.title: Great Bookbag for kids too.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for our sons - one in black and one gray and we’re very happy with both of them. Video included of all the stuff my 8 year old can hold in his bag. He feels very prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Karri Fieglein

customer_reviews.title: ... may sound weird to say a shoulder bag feels good, but this thing feels incredible
customer_reviews.text: It may sound weird to say a shoulder bag feels good, but this thing feels incredible. I love it and am so glad to have it. I've seen some comments critiquing that it doesn't have self-standing shape, but... Dude, seriously? This bag has expansive storage, wide pockets, and (again) is super comfortable. Frankly, if you have a problem with this bag, something is wrong with you. Five stars, hands down. And nobody paid me jack shiz for this review.
customer_reviews.author: mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good messenger bag.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is holding up well so far. I've been using it a couple day. The construction seems good. For the price it's quite good. I would have rather had snaps over Velcro for the closure, but that's just my preference. The zippers have yet to catch like some of the cheap Chinese bags. I will edit later if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quilty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bag on Jan, 2019. I use it daily carrying a laptop (Macbook air), college 1 subject notebook, and a bottle of water etc. Didn't last me 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainDave

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the bag I am thoroughly underwhelmed by the size and complete lack of features. This should be called “a bag”. It is small with virtually no features and no way to secure the top flap other than some unimpressive Velcro. Hopefully it will hold up but this is in no way a nice bag. It wasn’t expensive but I still feel like I paid too much. One small zippered pouch inside constructed of a low quality nylon material. I should have gotten something better. Not a whole lot different than a canvas shopping bag as far as features. Picture with book is to give scale of bag’s size.
customer_reviews.author: vegas mike

customer_reviews.title: Bag is coming apart
customer_reviews.text: I really love this bag but it is coming apart, hence the 2 stars. I will have to do some heavy stitching on it. I used it steady for one week at a convention and it was the perfect size but the shoulder strap pad totally came apart and the lining on the inside of the flap is separated from the front about 6 inches on both sides. When I felt the rip on the side I took a good look and without any effort I could have totally separated that whole piece. Either the canvas is rotten (cotton rots) or they didn’t grab enough of the edge as they sewed. We shall see
customer_reviews.author: BarefootDreamers

customer_reviews.title: Velco doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This bag stays closed with velcro and that does not last very long. The handle for the bag is on the bag, rather than the top, so if you hold the bag by just the handle and the velcro opens up (which it will) then the contents of your bag will likely fall out. I'm removing the velcro and adding my own buckle to keep the bag from opening. It'll work fine after that, but I wish I had just purchased a different bag. I may move the handle from the back to the top of the bag, as well, while I'm at it.
customer_reviews.author: Dvice

customer_reviews.title: Manly enough and durable
customer_reviews.text: I work with some rough dudes on maintenance for a large building compound. I thought for sure they'd harass me for my new "purse", but no. Apparently this looks manly enough that it didn't even warrant a comment. I was surprised. The compartments inside work well for my different things, and the weight distributes nicely. I'm a big dude and I don't have trouble with the length of the strap one bit. It fits very comfortably. Seems to be made nicely. If I ever need another I wouldn't hesitate to try this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks so bad like sulfur that I had to leave it outside
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst item I have ever received from Amazon not that the item was not as expected so much the color was wrong it said teal not blue but the smell that god awful sulfur smell that stunk up my whole house... And stayed in my nose for a few days I contacted the seller they never got back to me but I do want you to know that this is the worst smelling bag and item in general I have ever received From amazon, it’s awful and it will stay in your house for a while And your nose and everything Smh
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Lou

customer_reviews.title: Looks Like A Great Day Bag
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the best laid plans go astray. I bought this bag to use for our family's day trips out of town to our handicapped adult son's neurology appointments. I've yet to use it due to the big Covid-19 situation going on, hopefully "someday" I will use it after the world settles down. That aside, it's a great bag! I am very pleased with it's sturdiness, high quality, and spaciousness. I can see myself loading up all of the essential items it takes to split town for a day.
customer_reviews.author: S. G. Lake

customer_reviews.title: Lovely bag, but concerns,
customer_reviews.text: I have decided to get a zipper installed in the main compartment as I am going to a poor, high crime country. The bag is vulnerable to someone slipping their hand in the bag. Also getting snaps to lock the pockets. Then, the bag will be perfect. Otherwise, love it and that is why I am investing in a zipper and snaps. VERY comfortable strap! Also, the zip pouch inside the bag, when stuff is put in it, weighs the backside down. I think I may get that sewn to the back wall of the bag to add support.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice multipurpose bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to hold my MacBook, iPad and notebook. Everything fits perfect with plenty of room to spare. Keep in mind you should keep you computer and tablet in a protective sleeve. This bag offers no protection from bumps or drops. The outside pockets easily hold pens pencils and charging bricks and cables. The bag is light so it doesn’t add much weight to the rest. So far I love the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C.

customer_reviews.title: It's a kind of grungy-throwback I. Goldberg's bag. I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tomboy purse for work. The material is strong. It's roomy. There are a lot of pockets. It closes with strong velcro, but it's not totally clamp down secure. It's great if you are driving and have to grab things. I haven't taken it on a plane or on activity laden travels so I cannot vouch for how it would fare in that arena, but I sling it into the passenger seat from the drivers side every day and everything is good. My friend saw it and liked it too and ordered one. It's a kind of grungy-throwback I. Goldberg's bag. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: cocomix

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat if looking for a simple looking for  messenger bag!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully simple messenger bag! Most messenger bags on Amazon are overly ornate. This one though does the job without thrills in the best way possible. It's inner compartment is not separated (although it does include a little zipper pouch for keys or other small important items). The canvas is soft to the touch but still durable feeling. The only complaint about the product that I have is the color. The olive drab is really too dark. And doesnt look very olive drab like, if I could reorder I'd order the Army green or the tan. Overall though I highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cute bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for what my needs. I bought it as a work bag to carry files. It expands larger than it looks like it would. Good amount of pockets and the over flap covers the inside pocket and Velcro’s. The only thing I didn’t like is the color. I ordered this bag 2 times thinking they sent me the wrong bag. The bag I ordered is drab olive which turns out to be brown and not olive at all. But if you like brown it is cute just not the color I wanted. I did reorder it in Olive.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This bag is not sturdy and very flimsy. It might be okay for a purse but not for carrying a laptop or anything with some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room!
customer_reviews.text: Great space!! Fits two 1.5" binders and a history book. Love the material which is very sturdy. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is because of tge actual color. I ordered an olive drab and rhis is what came in the mail. I did not want something dark in the color scheme. Otherwise, love it. I am going to buy another one butvin a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made & Roomy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this messenger bag for about a week now, carrying around about ten pounds of items between my Macbook, charger, accessories, and maybe occasionally a textbook. All of the stitching seems sturdy, and then pockets provide plenty of room. I'm not worried about this breaking down or tearing any time soon, and at the price point it's better than I was expecting. Update: I've had the bag for over two months now - still no signs of tearing, loose stitching, etc. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: classic messenger bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a "diaper bag" for my son. He is a toddler now, so really we just basically use it to transport a change of clothes, some snacks and baby wipes. I really liked it at first, but the durability has been lacking. Seams are pulling out and the pad that rides on the shoulder strap is coming apart. It is awkward as it seems to "tip" and since velcro is the only closure, things can fall out. Perhaps it is fine for its intended use, but I haven't been as satisfied with it as I thought I would be.
customer_reviews.author: L. Selsor

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's very difficult to find a canvass satchel that's large, built well and under $30.00. This is about the only one I've found, so I was glad to buy it. It's well-built and should serve my needs quite well. The only negative comment I can give, and why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 , is that it would be better if it had some buckles or snaps or closures of some sort to prevent the pockets from opening and losing items should the bag tip over. But I think that's something I can add on my own and customize it. But it would certainly be better if those things were added professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Randy King

customer_reviews.title: It is better than a free walmart plastic grocery bag.
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I purchased from Amazon a "Lewis N. Clark Urban Gear Canvas Messenger Bag" 14 inch x 14 inch. That was a great bag. Unfortunately this bag I just purchased is the bare nothing - you can call it a messenger bag, but I don't think anyone would want to use it. Doesn't hold its shape. No zippers. Just a canvas bag. It is better than a free walmart plastic grocery bag.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag
customer_reviews.text: First, it only has one small zippered pocket so stuff is always falling out, second it’s cheaply made the one zipper broke it didn’t just get stuck the actual metallic loop part that the pull string ties on broke apart I was in no way forcing it, threads are also coming loose after using for about a month. Since the pockets have no zippers everything just flops around sloppily. It doesn't look good at all. Maybe mine was a bad bag, at least Amazon let me return it.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: I'm rough on my tote bags/messenger bags. I use it daily, it gets knocked around quite a bit, and I've got 3 big dogs at the house that will lay on it and whatnot from time to time. It's stayed high quality for maybe a year now. Ive washed it several times in the washer and dryer, no fraying, it doesn't look "brand new" per se, but it doesn't need to be replaced, either. For the price it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany hay

customer_reviews.title: Sweetbriar Classic Messenger Bag for EDC
customer_reviews.text: I am using this bag as my EDC carry bag. I like the design of the strap for carry and the bag is large enough for me to fit my essentials in. If the two front pockets were a bit more supportive I would probably give this a fifth star, but those pockets are a bit "floppy" and it one puts too much in them it makes it difficult to close the bag properly. The bag itself is fine and I like the material as it is soft works good for my needs, but as always YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Sausman

customer_reviews.title: Just what he needed
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag for my husband. He is disabled and carries a bit of stuff around with him. The drawstring backpack he was just a little too small and started to rip. This bag is big enough that he can fit his 10" tablet and all his other stuff and still have room left. The little pockets on the outside are perfect for his phone and other smaller items. and the strap is long enough that he can keep his hands free as he moves from place to place. Would definitely recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Strong & sturdy canvas that isn't stiff! Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my messenger bag daily for the past week. It is exactly what I was looking for! Item arrived quickly as usual (thank you amazon prime!) The bag is simple and sturdy. Just the right amount of pockets for my use. The padded shoulder support was a pleasant surprise. The canvas material is thick enough that it will be strong, while supple enough that the whole bag isn't stiff. Happy customer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Roxxanne T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for prison
customer_reviews.text: Just right for schlepping laptop, paperwork, waterbottle and other essentials while keeping my hands free. As a mental health professional in a prison environment utility and ease of use are important. This bag does it all - roomy, but not too big, sturdy, but not stiff and the cross body strap is the right size to distribute the weight evenly. My co-workers are envious! Thanks for a smart, practical messenger bag made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Ann B.

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love it but the color was slightly off and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love it but the color was slightly off and the should pad arrived torn. I contacted Sweetbrair and they quickly apologized and sent me a new bag, no charge. That’s excellent customer service but I was still a bit bummed. The replacement, although it matches the order color perfectly, it was a little smaller than the first bag and the pockets stitched unevenly. Also the material felt different. Like I said, I wanted to love it but ended up just liking it.
customer_reviews.author: Calicoconutz

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: The Bag is made of a really nice sturdy canvas with a good shoulder strap but the velcro for the main flap could be a little stronger. I have two 2" notebooks in there and they are filled. When I tug on it a little too hard, the flap comes undone a little too easily. That is one area I would improve but it's not enough to return it. Overall, however, I am pleased with the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Geiser

customer_reviews.title: Twisted strap
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving this bag, I noticed that the strap had a twist in it. Since both ends were sewn, there was no way to correct this except to cut the strap and resew it myself. I decided to return it instead. I’ve owned a number of bags and never had this problem before.
customer_reviews.author: Frugalman

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to my law student life
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, well made, simple bag. I am a law student so it has to withstand carrying some large and heavy books, and it is up to the task. I am able to fit my 13" macbook pro inside of its sleeve, two text books, a 5 subject notebook, computer charger, pencil case, and even a water bottle in one of the side pockets in this thing. If you are looking for a daily carry canvas messenger bag you can't beat this one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jared T.

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy bag for everyday use!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this bag for a few days, and so far, so good. Its very roomy and I carry a lot: My laptop ( this bag is not padded, so I it'sin a sleeve), a few folders, my 3 cup glass lunch container, and a half gallon jug of water. The Velcro is secure and I havent had an issue with things falling out. Very reasonably priced for the quality and size. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: This is not military canvas this is cheap canvas it's more like cloth
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and if you don't no what true military canvas is or a true military messenger bag is you will not know any better. It looks nice and has its pockets on the plus side. This touching seems to be fine for now why would I even mentions stitching because the fabric is so cheap and is not sewn in with a thick immaterial true canvas. It's made with cheap quality fabric
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough to hold a weight of a small dog.
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags so much. Not only does it last, but when you have a very hyper puppy that you can carry ontop of the bag and it doesn't get torn by his nails then you know you have a good messenger bag. Also have you seen the other companies bags. They raise the prices on uncomfortable messenger bag. Like ok I do admit I wish there were more pockets. But still. All stars are reached for me, I plan to buy more IF my bags ever decide to be ruined by the destruction of my dog. Which is horrifying how fast a puppy can chew up things.
customer_reviews.author: Kana Key Tora

customer_reviews.title: A solution to my need
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to throw. all my my gear into on my way to the car. I did not want the straps of a backpack in the mix. This tote is the solution to hold my gear an leave me hands free as I head out the door. first thing I did was apply scotchgard. A piece of velcro on the flap might be nice but not a show stopper. I am delighted with this bag and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ptarmagin

customer_reviews.title: Meh...its OK
customer_reviews.text: This is probably going back, I needed it to hold a huge Milady book, plus a binder, smaller book and ipad for cosmetology school and while it had enough space for everything, I found myself struggling with the bag falling all over the place and not holding the shape. I dont know how to best explain it other than it had no real defined shape. But ultimately, my real complaint is that I couldn't get the bag to stay upright when I put it down, it would fall over in different directions and everything would slide out. Maybe it was the size and weight of the Milady book, maybe it was the material, but I am done struggling with it
customer_reviews.author: Caseypagez

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill.
customer_reviews.text: This is a light-weight and seemingly durable bag. It has most of the features you would expect. The stitching looks even and the strand appears to be strong enough to keep it together. I’ll add an update as time goes by and I learn how it functions under real world conditions. The lower rating is based on my initial reaction to the product. I was hoping for a bit thicker canvas material. I worry about durability. Though for the cost I’m pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack C.

customer_reviews.title: Lint Magnet
customer_reviews.text: The bag works; it'll hold your books, it'll stay on your shoulder, it's a bag. Problems I found was that 1. It attracted a bunch of lint and ended up looking silly. and 2. The black color was very very black, darker than you'd think; looks a little too dark. I loved the velcro system though, it was so easy and efficient to just open it, throw a book in, and close it back up, had a feeling it would last a while. If you don't like lint; be wary!
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Periut

customer_reviews.title: great for stuff and freeing hands
customer_reviews.text: A few months ago I broke my ankle. I had a draw string shoulder bag that was pretty useless when using crutches. I got your bag about a week ago and it has made it so easy to carry almost anything from bottles of water, gater aid paper work and all the rest of my stuff and it stays where I put it. Delivery was the next evening and the price was right!!! Thank you guys for your service and keep up the good work!!!
customer_reviews.author: pizzaman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, good for patches
customer_reviews.text: Much roomier than I expected! I got this because my old bag was really digging into my shoulder and causing me trouble, the pad on this strap is much more forgiving, I'm already feeling the difference, though if you tend to swing your bag around a bit like I do it might give you a little bit of rugburn, which is to be expected. The material is also perfect for iron-on patches, it takes them like a dream, . The front pockets are big enough to hold an average sized novel with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Lee Searles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag!!
customer_reviews.text: I am IN LOVE with this bag!! It's the perfect color, and is so very strong and durable! I am using this to carry my daily items in and wanted to decorate it in patches and pins to make it my own. This is going to last me a long time! I can't be happier with this purchase! Thank you!! *Photo is of my bag after putting on my initial pins and patches.
customer_reviews.author: UnschoolMama5

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: U used to be a designer purse gal, to the TEE! Well, since working in the hustle and bustle in the city I realized you need BOTH of your hands all of the time! The crossover bag is everything! Honestly, I purchased an organizer insert to put inside so everything can be in its place, because it doesn't have any pocket, and then BOOM, I was all set. I carry everything in this but the kitchen sink. It is my home away from home!
customer_reviews.author: Keli C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Returning It
customer_reviews.text: This bag is super ugly in person and the fabric feels gross the to touch. I wasn't expecting much from a bag priced this low, but I am still disappointed. Now I get to spend $6 returning it. If you're on the fence, choose something else.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Be like Jack Bauer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! It has become my go-to camera bag. Get this and then add an Ape Case or a Tenba, and maybe a Domke Wrap and you will have one of the most versatile camera bags possible. The front pockets are pretty big so you can stuff in filter cases and extra batteries/sd cards. The side pockets accommodate my eyeglass case on one side and a water bottle on the other. You can't find a better value.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Fye

customer_reviews.title: Great size for flight carry on personal item
customer_reviews.text: The pockets are not completely secure when the bag is closed but it's not that big of a deal and it allows for quick access to your stuff. Seems like a durable material thats pretty soft on tablet screens. I use it for bible study fellowship notes and its comfortable to wear around one shoulder or around chest
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this messenger bag, the dimensions that were provided was not what I had received. I am very disappointed in the size. Other than that they could have used a more durable material. Seems like something you could have gotten at walmart for $10. So, yes! I do feel that I overpaid and was given an inferior bag. One final note, I asked for an OD Green and I got a Blue bag. So there you have it. not as good as I thought after have written it all out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Foster

customer_reviews.title: It’s falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I gave this item 5 stars. However, after gentle use for less than 2 months, it is already falling apart. The stitching is coming out and it’s slowly disintegrating. I was very happy with this product when I purchased it. It’s very disappointing for it to take such a negative turn.
customer_reviews.author: J. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Well made for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Just received this bag. Overall a good, solid, everyday slouchy purse/bag if that's the look you're going for. I gave it 4 out of 5 stars because it's not super high quality, but for the price range, it's great for what it is. All of the seams are nice and solid and it's super lightweight, which is a good thing, but I feel like that's what makes it seem a little lower quality. If you're not super picky and need a messenger style bag, it's a good bargain 👌 I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Not as thick as I thought but good to go
customer_reviews.text: Been using it several months and no problems. Canvass isn’t super thick but adequate for everyday use. 4 pockets in front which are covered by the flap. No fraying noted as of yet. I’ve carried several books, reading glasses, cell phone and other items with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: comfortable dave

customer_reviews.title: contents fall out pretty easily. I wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: It lacks any way of securing the pockets. Accordingly, contents fall out pretty easily. I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kindel

customer_reviews.title: Well made and utilitarian
customer_reviews.text: I am a voracious reader and carry multiple volumes and note taking journals everywhere I go, even from room to room in my home. This bag fit my needs very well. It is of ample capacity and attractively made of durable canvas and webbed strap. I expect long use from it.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Floppy and not quite olive drab
customer_reviews.text: The color was off. More brown than anything. I would have been much happier had they got the color right. Also, as per previous reviews, it's floppier than the stock pictures would suggest. It doesn't really hold a form, but otherwise functions like it should and is what it is, an inexpensive messenger bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Do

customer_reviews.title: Cat-approved
customer_reviews.text: We're not talking something super-amazing and likely to wow you, but the bag is solid and functional, and exactly as advertised. I got it for my laptop and whatever book I'm currently reading at the moment, which it fits quite comfortably, and a lot of my sketching supplies have migrated there as well. Also, I have to be careful about where I set it or my cat will instantly turn it into her new bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size with enough pockets for surf fishing
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a little larger than the ANTIQUE I have used for many years. I moved to Florida and like to fish surf with metal spoons, for my needs this is great as it holds all the stuff without needing a damn cart! Not a suitcase or back pack, just a simple bag
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: On time, intact and outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful "satchel" for carrying folders and notebooks. It has a flat bottom so you can, as I did, insert a flat-bottomed folder holder. I can remove this insert to easily access material. The flat bottom allows this bag to stand upright when placed on a desk or the floor, which is my preference. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Pastrick

customer_reviews.title: The husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my husband's barely there workbag, held together with string and yes, duct tape. Strong and simple were what I was after and this bag definitely checks those boxes. Maybe next time it will take less time to convince him to let me replace the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kitter

customer_reviews.title: Great little bag
customer_reviews.text: My son and I bought this for scouts, to keep books, paperwork, and the like. It is very comfortable to carry, quite roomy, and able to accommodate a 15" laptop plus easily. The pockets are great too. The only thing I might improve would be to have something to hold it closed better than velcro and a handle on the bag. the velcro works great, but if you're grabbing it from the back seat you have to be sure and grab it by the shoulder strap. Of course then it would be a different kind of bag. We love them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my granddaughter's husband who is a disabled veteran and an avid hiker. They are expecting their first baby, so I'm killing two birds with one stone. He can also use the bag as his own personal diaper bag when he takes the baby hiking with him . LOL
customer_reviews.author: LYNDA H HENDRIX

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This bag is too unstructured, too "floppy", to be of much use. I've tried to use it on several occasions, but the top won't stay attached, and items shift so much that it makes carrying it uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool, Functional and Spacious Shoulder Bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! Very spacious and functional and I love the WWII army retro design of it. I grew up in the 50-s and 60s when army-navy surplus stores were nearly as common as Walmarts are today. This has the look of that era, but the fabric is much more pliable and gentle to touch than were those stiff old bags you'd find in the old post-war days. This one has lots of pockets and can easily fit my 17" Macbook Pro with plenty more room and extra pockets for lots of other gizmos and paraphenalia. Really a smart design, almost luxuriously soft canvas and fun to flop over your shoulder with your stuff.
customer_reviews.author: R. O'B.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! I bought my first one in March 2017. I use it for work, carrying files, etc. around all day for court, etc. Very durable. I only bought a new one because the light brown one had ink stains. I bought the blue one thinking it would Would show ink stains less. It carries a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Graduation presents
customer_reviews.text: I already have this bag. So I bought two more. One for my great niece and bought her a new laptop for college and my girlfriend's son as well. Bought them both laptop's and these bags as graduation presents I have on I bought a while ago.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Vanderpool

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I just got it and it is exactly what I wanted, super simple canvas shoulder bag that can roll up and open really large when I need it to. I put a full day's beach supplies for me and my puppy in this bad boy. Not sure if it'll last, but I have no reason to believe it won't.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle in MA

customer_reviews.title: Ideal
customer_reviews.text: I was in the SERVICE, and for the most part carried everything in a “Ruck,”and needed a change. Then I remember messenger bags should do the trick, so that’s when I came upon you product on Amazon. I purchased two for the job, and they’ve worked out perfectly, having lots of room and compartments and now I have a different look. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This bag is mainly used as an everyday for my books and folders for work. Very spacious. Durable and comfortable. The only issue I can see will be the Velcro strip on the main flap, rubbing the canvas until it frays.
customer_reviews.author: jason p.

customer_reviews.title: as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I got the bag for school. I wanted a simple light messenger bag and this being similar to the old army bag I was all in. I ended up getting one more. each bag is setup for different days. good bag at a great price. they are built well. not as heavy material as the original GI bag but whos fighting in the trenches shopping online for gear anyway? definitely a good bag and worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag isn't too big, but big enough to fit all of my things in it. (And having a toddler plus 3 other kids, I tend to have a lot to carry around. It's small enough that I can use it as my every day purse. And it's super comfortable. The padded shoulder strap makes prevents it from digging into my shoulder. I'm able to fit all my normal things in there with no problems at all. Having the little pockets in the front is a plus because I can store stuff like bandaids and be able to find them quickly. It's large enough to fit a folder in it without bending it and having plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Swords

customer_reviews.title: Simple and practical
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I thought it looked small, but it expands long and wide. Its simple. I do wish there was a button or two on the pockets, but no complaints whatsoever. No sure its rain friendly. Would buy again, recommend. Low key, low maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Rodriguez Bros.

customer_reviews.title: Use as a Possibility Bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bag to us as a Possibility Bag during muzzle loading activities and competitions. The bag worked great! Front and side pockets used for frequently accessed items. Zipper pocket in large pocked used for jags and smaller items. Large pocket for bulky items. Being a soft bag it is comfortable for woods walks as it forms around body when worn cross body.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: An excellent storage solution for a man on the go
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably priced bag that provides my husband with a solution when we are out for the entire day and it’s a place to put all his stuff. The bag is lightweight and not padded so if you’re going to slide and iPad and you probably want some kind of extra cushioning on any of your electronica devices . This is the second bag we have purchased. The old bag did not wear out it’s simply became faded from many washings .
customer_reviews.author: Jane the consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and material.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this bag. The padding on the strap makes daily usage easy. The large quantity of pockets is useful, and the lid closes securely. The material is sturdy and appears to be holding up quite well to me lugging around a lot of junk. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: The pockets are more useable than most bags. The end pockets are large enough for water bottles.
customer_reviews.text: this bag works for me for carrying my essentials for the day. I give it 4 stars because the outside pocket don't have flaps or closures but I am keeping it although it is slightly larger than I prefer but without a solid bottom it bunches up and doesn't seem as large.
customer_reviews.author: E. Man

customer_reviews.title: Bag got ripped with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag to carry my laptop (a 13'' macbook) and my headphones, a pen. That is it. Even with such minimal weight and fairly minimal use, the bag got ripped, and a hole was generated in the right bottom corner of the bag, in <4 months of use. I understand this is a fairly economical product at ~$20, but still, if it cannot even last half an year with such low usage, not sure what was it built for. Very flimsily built and not at all recommended to folks, especially those who are thinking of adding a book or two with their laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Naga

customer_reviews.title: Meets the Challenge
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this bag would hold up - but so far it definitely has met that challenge. It gets knocked around on a daily basis and no problems. A lot more room than I imagined, easy to carry and looks great. Haven't had problems with the D-rings as some indicated. Best part - the price!
customer_reviews.author: MBabs

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cloth messenger bag with lots of different pockets, but no hard backing or padding, and this is perfect! Does not have any laptop support, but that's what I was looking for, so this bag does the trick! Well made and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect with a zipper
customer_reviews.text: I loved the bag. Unfortunately, it gaps open because it doesn't zip close. I had to return it because it was too easy for a someone to grab something out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Lori M. Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit much, a lot smaller than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag thinking it would replace my normal laptop bag, the material it is made of is great quality canvas but the Velcro seems pointless. They don’t advertise where there are Velcro strips in the pictures and honestly they don’t work for large laptops or books. I was only sad that it arrived with way less quality than advertised
customer_reviews.author: Jake Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great substirute or addition to a knapsack
customer_reviews.text: Truth be told, I wanted a bag like Jack's in "24". It's not going to win any style awards, but, regarding 'utility', it's unbeatable. I travel a lot and sometimes just day or 1 night. This is big enough for most people to get buy without other bulky options. It fits snug to your side and is easy to 'get to things' quick and easy, again unlike other options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a work bag
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag for a few months and I absolutely love it. I am a nurse and use this for my work bag. Very practical and great quality for the price. The strap has been sturdy and I love how it's thicker so it's a lot more comfortable than others. I have fit folders, a box of granola bars, big water bottle, and small jacket with no problem. I'm sure I could also fit my MacBook air in here if I really wanted to. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Useful tough every day bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. My son has used three in the course of middle school high school and now last year of college. We both love the bag. No nonsense useful tough bag. The ones we have replaced were still in good shape just wanted new ones. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: No closure for privacy
customer_reviews.text: The pictures show that the main pocket is covered. With my laptop in the bag, someone can literally see what it is. Both sides stick out and show what’s inside. TERRIBLE for a place where rain is a regular thing. It’s made of a strong material but there’s no “backbone” to the bag so it’s flimsy. And there’s no closure to the top. I love messenger bags but this one just won’t do.
customer_reviews.author: bakersdozen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality without being too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag, solid stitching, good space with nice pockets without being too big to manage. I wanted a bag that I could carry stuff to and from work, that I could sew my collection of funky patches on. The canvas is a light enough weight that I can sew my patches to the flap, but still feels sturdy. It is exactly what I wanted, and I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Becky F.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag A+
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag for costs. I bought one exactly like this one 20 years ago in Peru. It lasted me close to 16 years school, work, touring. This bag looks better made than that older bag from Peru and price was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Needs inside zipper for main pocket!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a olive drab, but got a brown! Another thing, the inside main pocket should have a zipper, if not at least a drawstring/cord! It has neither! Everything else overall is fine!
customer_reviews.author: KarinClark

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Great size without being heavy. I particularly like the handle on the back that I can grab before hanging in on my shoulder. The pockets in front are very roomy.
customer_reviews.author: LL Fam

customer_reviews.title: Meh, quality takes a turn for the worst...
customer_reviews.text: Bag was Okay, its very flimsy and quite cheaply made. It is not rugged and has no stiff edges, its basically a sack that will lump around your shoulder as you walk. I don't recommend this since it makes walking more awkward, uncomfortable, and just weird. I don't recommend, unless you like lumpy and annoying things on your back all day.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed J.

customer_reviews.title: I am a Med Nurse and I Love this bag.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is well made and should last many years. I will be using it for a work bag. I can get everything I need for my shift in this bag including my lunch. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: billy d

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag. Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It's durable and reasonably sized. Great for medium usage as an every-day carry. Velcros closed, so some modification if you want to really secure your items- but I haven't had a problem with it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Adacious Genious

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for what I need. I am able to carry everything in it and will be perfect for school. The strap could be a little longer for me, but I can work with it. I am thinking of purchasing another one to keep as backup.
customer_reviews.author: ajy1323

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and not very secure. Only the Velcro in two places to keep it closed, and items fall out. A zipper close under the flap would have provided better security
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect product!
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect product! Using it for a Star Wars costume and for general use. Love that there’s no brand logo on it so it’s perfect for a costume. Only small issue is that the Velcro that closes the main flap is weak and does not connect without really pushing it together, so it’s not the safest if you’re trying to product things from theft.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Poor velcro, No zips ....not firm shape (easily collapsing)
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing would be nice canvas cloth and great stitching. All the remaining are crappy: no support pad or frames, so the bag has not firm shape and easily collapses if it is not fully stuffed and shapes around waist while wearing that looks awkward. Further, Velcro is quite poor: not able to stick firmly- it gets off effortlessly. No zips and poor Velcro makes the things to fall out quickly - that means very purpose of a bag is lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn customer

customer_reviews.title: That dang strap...
customer_reviews.text: The ONE thing that ticks me off about this bag is that the strap keeps twisting in the metal holder. Also, the inside zipper broke. If they fixed this strap issue, this would be the PERFECT bag.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Simple messanger bag
customer_reviews.text: Mainly I wanted to get a bag that was not too large. This is the right size -- can carry papers and notebooks and supplies, has a handle as well as a shoulder strap, and the flap folds over and closes with velcro, so it's flexible. Good strong construction, just very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D. White

customer_reviews.title: Good bad for carrying all the school gear
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that the rectangular metal links that hold the strap to the bag turn sideways, which messes with the distribution of weight across the strap. It would be better if there were a way to hold the strap in place over those metal links so that they can't turn sideways or possibly go with a round link instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, easily accessed, and very useful
customer_reviews.text: The messenger bag was for my grandson that is in high school. He was very excited and really loved it. The quality of the bag could not be surpassed by anyone. The color is a perfect fit for his needs. It has ample room for all his books and supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Julio75

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The photo suggested that the top of the bag could be zipped up to prevent documents from falling out. This was not the case. It does contain a small interior pocket that can be zipped, but this is not enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: B.G. Uys deVilliers

customer_reviews.title: works good, doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can carry the bag over my should and it keeps my hands free. What I don't like is that I used the first bag for a little over a year twice weekly and both the cover and the inside of the bag that rests on your hip wore holes in them. Can't find anything better so I ordered another.
customer_reviews.author: Swifty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bag that I could just throw stuff in. Didn't need all the pockets and zipper places that other bags tout. This has one for a couple pens and such. Throw in my coffee thermos, kindle fire, a snack and I'm ready for the day. Strong canvas, will be easy to wash if needed and a very comfortable padded strap. Beats out my sling bag I've been using.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: A good solid messenger bag, exactly what I was looking for to haul my stuff to and from the office every day. I wouldn't use it for traveling -- it doesn't close securely and there isn't enough internal storage -- but for a daily bag it's great.
customer_reviews.author: DominHM

product_meta.title: Sweetbriar Classic Messenger Bag - Vintage Canvas Shoulder Bag for All-Purpose Use
product_meta.description:
Sweetbriar Vintage Messenger Bags offer rugged durability for modern all-purpose use. Direct-to-consumer prices allow for high quality at low cost. Updates feature top handle for easy pick-up portability and a shoulder pad for additional comfort.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :17.5 x 12 x 5 inches; 1.2 Pounds
 * Item model number :CMBB
 * Department :Unisex-adult
 * Date First Available :November 4, 2015
 * ASIN :B017KXTWSA

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #14,850 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #5 inMessenger Bags 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.4 out of 5 stars1,760 ratings Sweetbriar Vintage Messenger Bags offer rugged durability for modern all-purpose use. Direct-to-consumer prices allow for high quality at low cost. Updates feature top handle for easy pick-up portability and a shoulder pad for additional comfort.
feature_bullets: Roomy, Open Pockets: Features an extra large main compartment, front pockets, and side pockets big enough for all sizes of water bottles.
Upgraded Features: Convenient handle is located top-rear for easy carrying. Interior zippered pouch can carry small items. Includes a padded, length-adjustable shoulder strap for comfort.
Materials: Durable, 100% cotton canvas with metal accents. Front flap has a Velcro closure. Does not have padding or additional structural support.
Style: Retro Military Pack Army Outdoor School College Basic Travel Accessories.
Dimensions: 17.5 x 12 x 5". Weighs only 1.2 lbs. Easily fits all laptops 13", 14", and up to 15.6". Includes a 1 year Limited Warranty.
